alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 4:42PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Glynn and southeastern Wayne Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 442 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Everett, or 10 miles west of Darien. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Everett, Thalmann, Boys Estate and Mount Pleasant. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
